title: What are mixed and unmixed tracks? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unmixed tracks are referred to the tracks that we obtain when we record something. All the volume faders are at unity (or same level). The volumes of the tracks are not adjusted properly and hence the track doesn't sound systematic. A mixed track whereas, has all the volume levels properly adjusted according to the genre of the music, in addition to this, the processing is also done in the audio. Hence the audio sounds complete and is ready to master! I'm myself an audio engineer and a music producer. If you have any doubts related to mixing, you can ping me! Good luck.

For a track to be called a mixed track it has to undergo the following …. All imdividual stems or tracks aligned cut / edited / cleaned pasted on the Playlist tightlyEach track has its own mixer channel or atleast routed to a group busGainstaging done with levels of all tracks sounding levelledMost important things carried out adequately ie equing to ensure that the spectrum of frequencies is properly spread out with no overlapping of frequencies and hence no muddying of the track.. incl using of HP or LP filtersCompression applied to the tracks where needed.. to handle irregular levels / controlling of transients. Also to fatten up or flatten certain elements.Application techniques like side chain or NYC compression to bring out the essence of the trackApplication of effects such as reverb / delay / chorus / glitch / filters depending on genre.Vocals tightened up at consonants or layers.This track is now ready to be mastered or normalised Happy mixing!!
